intro: Solanum luculentum, commonly known as the yellow nightshade, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by berries that turn from green to yellow as they mature. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Solanum luculentum is part of the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other plants like tomatoes and potatoes.
